p: The results of the first inter-calibration, where the importance of sample extraction was tested are presented in Figs. 1 and 2 and Tables 1 and 2. A comparison between instruments when samples were measured directly, without extraction, are presented in Fig.Â 1, as relative fluorescence units (RFU) of each instrument. Scatter of the determined concentrations is high, which is reflected in the relatively low Spearman correlation coefficients that nevertheless are statistically significant ( Table 1). There was slightly better agreement (spearman correlation coefficient 0.98) between the Turner and Shimadzu fluorometers than between Shimadzu and Horiba (0.81) or Turner and Horiba (0.83).
